intro: Reinwardtiodendron kostermansii, commonly known as the Koster's reinwardtiodendron, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly found in countries like Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its woody stem, lance-shaped leaves, and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. It typically grows in dry, open habitats such as savannas and rocky areas. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
